summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Ancient Aliens Season 5 Volume 2 [DVD]
Review Date: 2014/07/20
Store: John Hoffman  (Director)    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD
Product Description: ['ANCIENT ALIENS: SEASON 5, VOLUME 2 from HISTORY investigates the topic from many angles. "Emperors, Kings and Pharaohs" explores whether ancient leaders, usually attributed with divine powers, were actually connected to extraterrestrial forces. "Alien Operations" examines advanced medical procedures practiced in the ancient world, as evidenced by wall carvings and skeletal remains. Did these skills come from an otherworldly source? Archaeologists ponder the healing power of ancient objects like sacred bones in "Mysterious Relics" and luminous, skull-shaped crystals in "The Crystal Skulls". Do these controversial artifacts hold the secrets to the universe? And were giant-winged deities known as Anunnaki responsible for ancient Sumerian leaps in advancement? Find out in "The Anunnaki Connection". This provocative collection also includes "The Satan Conspiracy," "The Power of Three" and "The Magic of the Gods".']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'TV', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'John Hoffman', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '28929185', 'Director': 'John Hoffman', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '5 hours and 52 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 4, 2014', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: Love this series and this volume might be the best yet!
Review Title: May be the best one yet
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Ancient Aliens: Season 7 [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2015/07/30
Store: Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray
Product Description: ["What supernatural lives will be revealed by the 10,000-year-old prehistoric artwork discovered in a cave in India? Could the face of Giza's Great Sphinx prove to be older than once thought, and what otherworldly being might it actually represent? History continues its exploration of unexplained events and phenomena in this Ancient Aliens collection that journeys through the Egyptian pyramids, Central American temples, and Earth's enigmatic caves, offering viewers a detailed account of the mysteries of life that continue to elude us."]
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'TV', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'ANCIENT ALIENS: SEASON 7 - VOLUME 1', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '46768', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Run time': '8 hours and 48 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 21, 2015', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'}

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analyzed purchase history indicates a strong inclination towards high-quality entertainment content, particularly documentary series and sitcoms. The individual exhibits a consistent preference for themes surrounding mysteries, particularly those related to ancient history and extraterrestrial phenomena, as noted by the consistently high ratings (averaging 4.8-5.0) for the "Ancient Aliens" series. This suggests a sentiment of enthusiasm and engagement with these narratives. 

In terms of usage, most purchases serve as leisure or entertainment. The person shows a preference for notable genres like documentaries, sitcoms, and dramas, particularly valuing originality and storytelling depth. Price sensitivity does not appear to be a significant concern, as they consistently opt for varied formats such as DVD and Blu-ray, indicating a willingness to invest in quality media. 

Furthermore, the predominant positive sentiment in reviews ("best," "love," "favorite") suggests an appreciation for shows that deliver consistent entertainment value and creative narratives. Overall, the core preferences reflect an affinity for engaging, high-production-value content across diverse genres, with a specific tilt towards themes of history and human experiences.
